Subjects: advice, moral; aphorisms; crucifixion; Christ, warnings to man
_description: Moral advice to ‘Sir Eode’ — two couplets

CamTCC323.First Lines:
bisete þine poueþis sire eodeþeng on poremennis
                    neode
CamTCC323.Last Lines:
betere þe were of god medeþenne in helle mid
                    veinde
CamTCC323.Note:
Christ from the Cross, possibly related: ‘In cruce sum pro te
                        si peccas desine pro me sic homo diligo te sic victima pendeo pro te vt
                        viuas morior non est dileccio maior (f. 25rb).
CamTCC323.Editions:
James,  Montague Rhodes. 
             Catalogue of the
                    Western Manuscripts in the Library of Trinity College, Cambridge.
         4 vols. Cambridge: at the UP, 1900-1904: 1.440.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             English Lyrics of the XIIIth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1932: 176.
